name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @JamesLinHPC @ogawa_tter Impressive!

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: Now giving a keynote at #ISC21 ExaComm Workshop keynote talk focusing on interconnects on Fugaku and future.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @JamesLinHPC @HPC_Guru You have done well, my young apprentice!

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: Now making a recorded presentation as the first speaker of #ISC21 HPC in Asia session. I am presenting not only Fugaku but other new machines in the Japanese HPCI, collectively helping Japan to recapture the No.2 capacity spot, exceeding China.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: A talk every night for me at #ISC21. Last night was exascale, tonight it is HPC in Asia Japan update, and tomorrow night keynote at the Exacomm workshop  https://t.co/aT8GDxM8CV in which I will talk about Tofu-D and future interconnects we are considering for FugakuNext.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @HPC_Guru I believe it is 8. C.f. TaihuLight, they 2x no. nodes. 2x core groups/node, 2x vector width, maintain clock frequency, resulting in 8x over TaihuLight which is a 125PF Rpeak system. The only change from the user view is vector width, thus the (tough) programming remains the same

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @giIIes @science_dot @hpcprogrammer @hpcjoe @HPC_Guru @glennklockwood @hpcnotes @9550pro And this makes perfect sense as DoE will likely spend > 3x what MEXT will spend on #Fugaku to field 3 machines that will match or exceed #Fugaku performance on real apps.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @magicsilicon Soichiro Honda served as founder CEO for Honda for 27 years but remained as the board member and supreme advisor (and president of the Honda research lab) for the next 10 years with the company even after stepping down as CEO.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: Very happy to be running *shrink wrapped* RHEL on #Fugaku, with an OS instance on every one of its 158,976 nodes, or nearly 8 million Arm SVE cores.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @johnclinford We are starting to take a real deep dive into the true needs of future applications, to co-design towards the next gen. In the process, if we determine that certain benchmark metric is deprecated, then we shall not seek to excel in that, rather prioritizing ‚Äúapplications first‚Äù.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @johnclinford So we are excited by the prospects of next wave of US Exascale machines possibly starting late 2021 to match or exceed those numbers. However, it is also clear that evolution of some of these metrics, especially Linpack, will slow down & become less significant at the same time.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @johnclinford Assuming 11x scaling, Selene would be about 57% faster or about 0.7PF in Linpack, not quite Exaflops; for HPCG, significant for most HPC apps it would be about the same as #Fugaku. Where it would excel would be HPL-AI in which it would exhibit approx 7EF, or about 3.5x Fugaku!

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @hpcprogrammer @HPC_Guru Thanks. The most impressive performance gains however were made by NVIDIA GPU driven machines on HPL-AI, where the performance & efficiency jumped dramatically by 2x or more c.f. 2020, allowing Summit to surpass 1 Exaflops on HPL-AI.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: And congrats to #Arm for powering the fastest system in the world in all respects. We sure have come quite far from the early days of Acorn, the genesis of #Arm. Shows what you can do with the right ideas, with sustained, persistent will.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @Prof_DavidBader @riken_en Thanks very much! While #Fugaku is just beginning, with our Society5.0/SDGs/DX focus, the new efforts are already starting for the future as well.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: #Fugaku is awarded 3 consecutive supercomputer No.1 honors on the four important performance benchmarks: #Top500, #HPCG, HPL-AI, and #Graph500. We are very proud & appreciative. R-CCS will hold a press conference describing the achievement as well as our Society5.0 efforts.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: Big congrats!! I was honored in 2018 too and was extremely honored, as it is a career award directly awarded by your peers in the CS academics inside of the larger HPC community.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: @JeffdotLayton I am sure the vaccination itself will not be a problem. Hopefully international vaccine passport will be in place by then, probably based on the EU proposal, and borders reopened as well as quarantine procedures minimized in time.

name: Satoshi Matsuoka
tweet: Of course we have high expectations. One thing tho is that, AMD chiplets are small as they should be, whereas it would be disruptive for Intel to adopt that model. Then the big question is, once they do what would happen to to their fab economics.
